poem:
"Ode to an Unfinished Box of Chocolates"

In the quiet moments of winter's morn,
straying hands chance upon forgotten treat,
Crinkle of paper, a sweetness reborn,
childish delights that adult tastes cannot beat.
From Quality Street to Venchi's high cost,
each message inside a cocoa-coated post.
An echo of Christmases, some won, some lost,
fleeting, yet loved, adored the most.
